image.altText: Grey-haired man with glasses smiling in backyard

props.synopsis: While some growing high-density locations are being applauded for incorporating open space with community facilities and transport, others are criticised as "dormitory suburbs" lacking in life.

title.children: For some, high-rise living helps solve the housing crisis. Others warn it’s making things worse

image.altText: Parramatta fatal shooting morning

props.synopsis: Police were called to Harold Street in Parramatta just after 3:30am following reports of a shooting.

title.children: Man killed in early morning shooting in Parramatta

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and red tie and a woman in a camel-coloured suit and white shirt

props.synopsis: Americans remain deeply polarised over their choice between Kamala Harris or Donald Trump in November's presidential election. In Australia, a new survey suggests one candidate has overwhelming support.

title.children: Harris or Trump? If Australians were voting, the result would be a landslide

image.altText: A police officer stands on a highway. Behind him there is a number of items scattered on the roads.

props.synopsis: The woman, in her 40s, remains in a serious but stable condition in hospital. Her partner who suffered self-inflicted wounds is also in a serious but stable condition.

title.children: A man allegedly stabbed his partner while driving then crashed in Sydney. Here's what we know

image.altText: A man wearing a turban and pale red shirt holds a woman with a black shirt and black hair with her back to the camera

props.synopsis: Pawanjeet Heir was treated like a slave as she pursued the requirements for permanent residency in Australia. Her husband says she has been punished for speaking up.

title.children: Pawanjeet Heir's boss was running a migration scam. Speaking up put her visa at risk

image.altText: A digital board with multiple rows reading "cancelled".

props.synopsis: A long-awaited blueprint for the aviation sector will be handed down today, including a promise to establish a charter of rights for customers to seek cash refunds when their flights are cancelled or unreasonably delayed.

title.children: Australians will be able to get cash refunds for delayed and cancelled flights under government crackdown

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair wearing a gold tracksuit top hands a tall baton to a young girl.

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Games Australia (CGA) oversees the allocation of millions of dollars of funding to different sports and has roles pushing for green and gold success at international events — but behind the scenes its boardroom has become divided.

title.children: The governance dispute that's split the top ranks of Australia's peak Commonwealth Games body

image.altText: Ukrainian emergency personnel work among the rubble of a destroyed hotel

props.synopsis: Reuters said it was urgently seeking more information, working with the authorities in Kramatorsk.

title.children: Reuters staff member missing after Russian strike on Ukrainian hotel

image.altText: A group of men in red berets stand in a huddle

props.synopsis: Hezbollah and Israel's war is escalating. Four Corners travelled to Lebanon's Hezbollah heartland and found a group determined to hit back.

title.children: Hezbollah's fight with Israel is entering a new phase. Four Corners went to the militia's heartland, where death dominates life

image.altText: Two rugby leage commentators look surprised and each hold a hand up by their side.

props.synopsis: Locals in the NSW Upper Hunter are reeling from two earthquakes that hit the regional town in as many days. Authorities are still assessing the extent of the damage.

title.children: 'Never felt anything like that': How Upper Hunter earthquakes cracked windows, interrupted footy commentary

image.altText: Qld heat Southbank sunbathers August 25

props.synopsis: It may be the last week of winter but temperatures are rising across Australia — and in several places, winter heat records have already been broken.

title.children: 'No reprieve in sight' to unseasonably hot weather after new winter records set

image.altText: A close up of a man with blonde hair smiling with his dog on a porch.

props.synopsis: The right to disconnect means you can reasonably refuse to be contacted outside of work hours. For people tied to the 'digital leash' of phones and email this marks a substantial boost in their right to break free.

title.children: Are you checking work emails and answering calls after hours? It could end today

image.altText: Maggie Beer

props.synopsis: In a statement on social media on Sunday night, her family said she fell at home, sustaining minor bone fractures and related injuries.

title.children: Australian food icon Maggie Beer injured after fall at home

image.altText: Woman holding a young toddler.

props.synopsis: Months after Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom was killed in an Israeli air strike, her brother Mal sits down with 7.30 to discuss the missing pieces of the puzzle the Israeli government still has not shared.

title.children: Israel withholding audio from strike that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom

props.synopsis: A senator is calling for the government to end its long-standing relationship with South Korea's Eastern Social Welfare Society after a Background Briefing investigation revealed the agency falsified documents in historical adoption cases, dating back to the 1980s.

title.children: Calls grow to end Australia's adoption ties with South Korea after scandal

image.altText: A yellow sign says footpath closed and yellow

props.synopsis: Seismologist Michael Turnbull predicts "reasonably sized" earthquakes of at least magnitude 3 could hit the area for the next couple of months.

title.children: Aftershocks expected to rattle the NSW Upper Hunter for months

image.altText: The Paralympic Flame is lit in England ahead of the 2024 Paris Games.

props.synopsis: With the Paris opening ceremony only days away, the Paralympic Flame is lit in Stoke Mandeville, an English village widely considered the birthplace of the Games.

title.children: Paralympic Flame lit before beginning exceptional journey to Paris

image.altText: Two men sit at a desk, one is wearing a green shirt, the other a plaid shirt and headphones.

props.synopsis: A new mental health charity is helping Australian dads overcome loneliness by connecting men through online gaming.

title.children: Taurean hadn't made friends outside of work for 15 years. Then he found a network of dads

image.altText: A man stands in front of a flower bed in full bloom.

props.synopsis: Flowers planted for Canberra's Floriade festival are blooming weeks ahead of schedule due to warmer weather, while commercial horticulturalists are having to adapt their planting to meet the changing seasons.

title.children: No, it's not your imagination. Spring has arrived weeks earlier and gardeners are having to adapt

image.altText: A thumbnail showing different fires caused by battery faults.

props.synopsis: New South Wales has reported 185 lithium ion battery fires up until August this year, with more than six battery fires per week. Fire and Rescue NSW has referred to battery fires as "the fastest growing fire risk" in the state.

title.children: 'Fastest-growing fire risk': Exploding everyday items now 'top issue' for fire authorities

image.altText: Bill Shorten at a press conference

props.synopsis: NDIS Minister Bill Shorten defends reforms to the disability scheme passed last week, saying the $14 billion in savings come from "cost reductions", not cuts.

title.children: 'This is not a cut': Shorten defends NDIS reforms that will save government $14b

image.altText: A billboard shows a smiling woman in colourful dress, and welcomes people to the 53rd Pacific Islands Forum.

props.synopsis: Pacific leaders are once again preparing for the Pacific Island Forum, the biggest meeting of the year, where they will gather and discuss some of the most pressing and complex issues facing the region.

title.children: In Tonga's sprawling archipelago, a meeting of Pacific leaders could reshape the region

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with long blonde hair sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: Annual drug overdose deaths in Australia have almost doubled over the past 20 years. Advocates say it's time governments change the way they tackle the issue.

title.children: When police came to her door, Jen was worried her daughter had been arrested. The reality was far worse

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard leans over bushfire bunker built into ground

props.synopsis: An Adelaide Hills father installed a six-person bushfire bunker at his property after the 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, without first seeking planning approvals — now, the council have issued a removal notice — a decision which he is appealing.

title.children: Daniel Katz installed a 'last resort' bunker after fleeing a bushfire, but he's been told to remove it

image.altText: Drone exploding mid air with orange fire and flames coming out of the back

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it launched further attacks against Hezbollah rocket sites in southern Lebanon, hours after it announced a pre-emptive strike against the Iran-backed Lebanese group.

title.children: Hezbollah launches attack on Israel with large number of drones, as Israel stages further strikes inside Lebanon

image.altText: BluLink live stream

props.synopsis: Members of the public can now click on a link that is sent to their smartphone when they call triple-0. A limited trial has already been used in cases including the fatal Bondi Junction stabbing in April.

title.children: People who call triple-0 in NSW can now live stream their emergency to police

image.altText: Half a dozen special police forces stand in full helmet and camo gear

props.synopsis: Officers arrested a suspect during a raid on a hostel for asylum seekers on Saturday, not far from the scene of the attack.

title.children: German police say suspect confessed to fatal knife attack at festival

image.altText: A Roosters NRLW player holds back a Titans opponent wrestling with another Rooster, as a fan yells behind them.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast show they remain a team to beat in the NRLW with a spiteful 26-6 win over the Roosters, while Brisbane come back to beat Wests Tigers 44-14.

title.children: Titans reassert NRLW authority, Broncos survive scare

image.altText: Jonathan Simonds wears anti-war badges including one that says 'not another bomb'.

props.synopsis: While America's Democratic diehards enjoyed pep talks and pop music at their party-vibes convention this week, a smaller panel event on the sidelines was striking a very different tone.

title.children: Why some Democrats think a 'boneheaded mistake' could threaten Kamala Harris's election chances

image.altText: Albanese and Bullock

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says he won't abolish the government's power to overrule the Reserve Bank, but he will try to restrict its ability to be used.

title.children: The government will keep its power to overrule the RBA. Even though it's never been used

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Dr Fauci, 83, is now recovering at home after spending about seven days in hospital after being bitten by an infected mosquito.

title.children: Anthony Fauci in recovery after week-long hospitalisation with West Nile virus

image.altText: A woman holding a silver trophy while wearing white gloves

props.synopsis: Theodore Tennis Club has six courts, 123 members, a modest clubhouse and a trophy cabinet with an impressive display.

title.children: Tennis star gifts championship trophy to tiny hometown club

image.altText: A man with dark hair holds the face of a serious looking woman with blonde hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Any efforts to kickstart conversations about abuse should be applauded. But as a serious reflection of what domestic violence is really like, It Ends With Us falls short.

title.children: The truth of violent marriages is lost when Hollywood refuses to face the dark reality

image.altText: Mountainous rocks peek through surrounding gum tree forests.

props.synopsis: There are hundreds of dormant and extinct volcanoes across south-east Australia. They aren't likely to burst into life but it is "almost a given" that a new volcano will form somewhere else, according to a geosciences lecturer.

title.children: New volcanoes will erupt in Australia's south-east but whether that could happen in 100 years — or 5,000 — isn't known

image.altText: Chris Pearson portrait

props.synopsis: An inquiry ordered following a Four Corners investigation into the Public Trustee concluded that the agency's actions "in the main … were appropriate". Refunds and a misplaced account tell a different story.

title.children: Facing questions from the ABC, the Public Trustee found a client's misplaced account containing $73,000
